      DatabaseConnection()

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseConnection

        public DatabaseConnection()
        Constructor of the class DatabaseConnection, example database of MySQL called sakila is used as temporary db to check if connection is working

    • Method Detail

      • connectToDatabase

        public boolean connectToDatabase(java.lang.String host,
                        java.lang.String database,
                        java.lang.String user,
                        java.lang.String password)
        connection to database is established
        Parameters:
        host - String, in this case "localhost:3306" (3306 is port)
        database - String, name of the database you want to connect to, at the beginning "sakila"
        user - String, name of the user, in this case "user"
        password - String, password, in this case "riazdh"
        Returns:
        boolean, true if connection was successful, otherwise false

      • createDatabase

        public boolean createDatabase(java.lang.String sql)
        Create a database, using string as sql statement
        Parameters:
        sql - String, sql statement that is executed
        Returns:
        boolean, true if execution of statement was successful

      • createTable

        public void createTable()
        one table called geometries is created, all types of geometries can be stored inside this table, attributes: ID of type integer, Type of type varchar [(p)oint,(l)ine,(r)ectangle], coordinates of type integer [X1/Y1, X2/Y2]
        Parameters:
        sql_statement - String to create table

      • getID

        public int getID(java.lang.String table)
        Deprecated. not used anymore, was created before primary key was auto_increment(ed)
        method to get the number of entries and thereby derive the id
        Parameters:
        table - String, name of the table
        Returns:
        integer value of the highest ID-value

      • getData

        public java.lang.String getData(java.lang.String sql)
        SQL statement is executed and then all the table entries are saved as one string
        Parameters:
        sql - String of the sql statement that needs to be executed
        Returns:
        String that includes all geometries in table, separated by ";", e.g. "id,type,x1,y1,x2,y2;id,type,x1,y1,x2,y2;..."

      • writeData

        public boolean writeData(java.lang.String sql)
        Geometries are written in the database and inserted into table geometries
        Parameters:
        sql - String, insert statement for the insertion of geometries in table
        Returns:
        boolean, true if insertion was successful

      • changeData

        public boolean changeData(java.lang.String sql)
        Changes coordinates for geometries in table
        Parameters:
        sql - String, update statement to change attributes in table or delete statement to delete entries
        Returns:
        boolean, true if execution of statement was successful
